25:T13cb,<entryFree id="n32713" key="غَارَ أَهْلَهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">غَارَ أَهْلَهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (S, Msb,) and <foreign lang="ar">غار لَهُمْ</foreign>, (TA,) aor. <foreign lang="ar">يَغِيرُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">غِيَارٌ</foreign> (S, Msb) and <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرٌ</foreign>, (Msb, TA,) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مَارَهُمْ</foreign>, (S, Msb, TA,) i. e. <hi rend="ital">He brought,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conveyed, to his family,</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مِيرَة</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">a provision of corn,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wheat,</hi> &amp;c.] (Msb.) [See also art. <foreign lang="ar">غور</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And <hi rend="ital">He benefited them.</hi> (S, K, * TA.) 'AbdMenáf Ibn-Riba El-Hudhalee says <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">مَا ذَا يَغِيرُ ٱبْنَتَىْ رِبْعٍ عَوِيلُهُمَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">What will their loud weeping benefit,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">avail, the two daughters of Riba?</hi>] meaning that their weeping for their father will not avail them aught in lieu of seeking his blood-revenge. (S, TA.) You say <foreign lang="ar">غَارَهُمْ بِخَيْرٍ</foreign>, (S, K, TA,) aor. and inf. n. as <pb n="2315"/> above, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">He</hi> (God) <hi rend="ital">bestowed upon them abundance of the produce of the earth, and rain;</hi> (TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">غور</foreign>;) like as you say <foreign lang="ar">أَعْطَاهُمْ خَيْرًا</foreign>: (S, K:) and so <foreign lang="ar">غارهم بِرِزْقِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He bestowed upon them means of subsistence</hi>]. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">اَللّٰهُمَّ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">غِرْنَا بِخَيْرٍ</foreign> (S, Msb) <hi rend="ital">O God, benefit us with prosperity.</hi> (Msb.) And <foreign lang="ar">غَارَهُمْ بِمَطَرٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He</hi> (God) <hi rend="ital">watered them with rain,</hi> (S, K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">and bestowed upon them abundance of the produce of the earth.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">غَارَ الأَرْضَ الغَيْثُ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The rain watered the land.</hi> (Fr, S.) [See also art. <foreign lang="ar">غور</foreign>.]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غَارَهُ</foreign>, aor. <foreign lang="ar">يَغِيرُهُ</foreign>, (AO, S, K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرٌ</foreign>, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">He gave him the bloodwit;</hi> (AO, S, K;) as also <foreign lang="ar">غارهُ</foreign>, aor. <foreign lang="ar">يَغُورُهُ</foreign>; (AO, S, TA;) <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ أَخِيهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">for his brother</hi>]: and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32713-1" target="غيّرهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n32713"/></foreign>. (TA.) [See <foreign lang="ar">غِيرَةٌ</foreign>.]       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غَارَ عَلَى أَهْلِهِ</foreign>, (S,) or <foreign lang="ar">على ٱمْرَأَتِهِ</foreign>, (Msb, K,) aor. <foreign lang="ar">يَغَارُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرَةٌ</foreign>, (S, Msb, K,) with fet-h, (S, Msb, TA,) and <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">غَارٌ</foreign> (S, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">غِيَارٌ</foreign>, (K,) [<hi rend="ital">He was jealous of his wife:</hi>] <hi rend="ital">he was jealous for her</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">مِنْ فُلَانٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">of such a one:</hi> Mgh): [<hi rend="ital">he was careful of her, to avoid suspicion:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he regarded her conduct with disdain, scorn,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indignation:</hi> (see <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرَةٌ</foreign>, below:) or] <hi rend="ital">he was angry at the conduct,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">action, of his wife.</hi> (Msb.) And <foreign lang="ar">غَارَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُهُ عَلَيْهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">His wife was jealous of him:</hi> &amp;c.]. (M, b, K.) [See also art. <foreign lang="ar">غور</foreign>.] And you say also, <foreign lang="ar">فُلَانٌ لَا  <ref cref="n32713-2" target="يَتَغَيَّرُ" n="2" type="6" subtype="FTFSO" lang="ar"/> عَلَى أَهْلِهِ</foreign>, meaning <foreign lang="ar">لَا يَغَارُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Such a one is not jealous of his wife:</hi> &amp;c.]. (TA.)    </entryFree>26:T9dc,<entryFree id="n32714" key="غيّر الشَّىْءَ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>2</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">غيّر الشَّىْءَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (S, Msb, K, *) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَغْيِيرٌ</foreign>, (Msb,) <hi rend="ital">He made the thing other than it was;</hi> (K;) <hi rend="ital">made it cease to have the quality which it had;</hi> (Msb;) <hi rend="ital">altered it; changed it.</hi> (K.) <hi rend="ital">He,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, altered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">changed, the thing in odour,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">otherwise, for the worse; corrupted, tainted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infected, it; rendered it ill-smelling, stinking, fetid, rancid, rank, fusty,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frouzy.</hi> (The lexicons passim.) It is said in the Kur [viii. 55], <foreign lang="ar">ذٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللّٰهَ لَمْ يَكُ مُغَيِّرًا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">نِعْمَةً أَنْعَمَهَا عَلَى قَوْمٍ حَتَّى يُغَيِّرُوا مَا بِأَنْفُسِهِمْ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">This was because God changeth not favour which He hath conferred upon a people until they change what is in themselves:</hi> or] <hi rend="ital">until they change what God hath commanded them to do.</hi> (Th, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [And <hi rend="ital">He exchanged the thing for another thing.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غيّر الشَّيْبَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He plucked out the white,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoary, hairs.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غيّر عَنْ بَعِيرِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He put down the saddle from his camel, and put it to rights,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjusted it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repaired it.</hi> (TA.) One says <foreign lang="ar">تَرَكَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">القَوْمَ يُغَيِّرُونَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He left the people putting to rights,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjusting,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repairing, the camels' saddles.</hi> (S, TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also 1, latter half.    </entryFree>27:T71f,<entryFree id="n32714-2" key="غَاْيَرَ">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>3</itype>        
                     <orth lang="ar">غَاْيَرَ</orth>
                  </form> [<foreign lang="ar">غَايَرَا</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">مُغَايَرَةٌ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">They differed, each from the other.</hi>] You say <foreign lang="ar">بَيْنَهُمَا مُغَايَرَةٌ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Between them two is a difference.</hi> (Msb.) [See also 6.]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غايرهُ</foreign>, (S, K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">مُغَايَرَةٌ</foreign>, (S,) <hi rend="ital">He bartered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exchanged, with him, in buying and selling.</hi> (S, K.) And <foreign lang="ar">غايرهُ بِالسِّلْعَةِ</foreign>, inf. n. as above, <hi rend="ital">He bartered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exchanged, the article of merchandise with him.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">غاير السِّلْعَةَ</foreign>, (TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">غِيَارٌ</foreign>, (S, K, TA,) <hi rend="ital">He exchanged the article of merchandise.</hi> (S, * K, * TA.) El-Aashà says <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">فَلَا تَحْسِبَنِّى لَكُمْ كَافِرًا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">وَلَا تَحْسِبَنِّى أُرِيدُ الغِيَارَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Therefore do thou by no means think me ungrateful towards you; and do thou by no means think I desire the making an exchange</hi>]. (S, TA.)    </entryFree>28:T4da,<entryFree id="n32716" key="تغيّر" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>5</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">تغيّر</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> quasi-pass. of <foreign lang="ar">غيّر</foreign>, (S, Msb,) [<hi rend="ital">It became other than it was;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">it ceased to have the quality which it had;</hi> (Msb;) <hi rend="ital">it became altered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">changed,</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عَنْ حَالِهِ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">from its state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition.</hi> (K.) <hi rend="ital">It became altered,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">changed, in odour,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">otherwise, for the worse; turned,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turned bad; became corrupted, spoiled, tainted, infected, illsmelling, stinking, fetid, rancid, rank, fusty,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frouzy.</hi> (The lexicons passim.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [And <hi rend="ital">It became exchanged for another thing.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  See also 1, last signification.    </entryFree>29:T4475,<entryFree id="n32719" key="غَيْرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">غَيْرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> signifies <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">سِوًى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Other</hi>]: and the pl. is <foreign lang="ar">أَغْيَارٌ</foreign>: (S:) [but <foreign lang="ar">غَيْر</foreign> itself often has a pl. meaning, as will be seen in what follows:] or [accord. to general usage, as will be seen below,] <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرُ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">سِوَى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">other than; exclusively of;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not,</hi> as used before a substantive or an adjective]. (Msb, K: in the CK [erroneously] <foreign lang="ar">سِوًى</foreign>.) It is used to qualify a subst.; [governing (as a prefixed noun) the noun that follows it in the gen. case;] and when so used, it is put in the same case as the noun preceding it. (S.) It qualifies an indeterminate noun: (Mughnee, Msb:) you say <foreign lang="ar">جَآءَنِى رَجُلٌ غَيْرُكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">A man, other than,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not, thou, came to me</hi>]: (Msb:) and <foreign lang="ar">نَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">We will in that case do good, other than,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not, what we used to do:</hi> (Kur xxxv. 34:)]: (Mughnee:) and <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ مَآءٍ غَيْرِ آسِنٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Of water other than,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not, altered in taste and colour</hi>]. (Kur xlvii. 16.) It is a noun necessarily prefixed, as to the sense, to a noun which it governs in the gen. case: but sometimes it is without the latter, when the meaning is understood and it is preceded by <foreign lang="ar">لَيْسَ</foreign>, (Mughnee, K,) or by <foreign lang="ar">لَا</foreign>: (K:) [in which case it signifies <hi rend="ital">Any other person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing; any person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing beside,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">else:</hi>] you say <foreign lang="ar">قَبَضْتُ عَشَرَةً لَيْسَ غَيْرُهَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I received ten; not other than they</hi> was received by me; i. e., <hi rend="ital">not any other thing;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not anything beside,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">else</hi>]; (Mughnee, K;) the enunciative, <foreign lang="ar">مَقْبُوضًا</foreign>, being suppressed: (Mughnee:) and <foreign lang="ar">ليس</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرَهَا</foreign>, (Mughnee, K;) the noun [of <foreign lang="ar">ليس</foreign>] being understood; i. e., <foreign lang="ar">لَيْسَ المَقْبُوضُ غَيْرَهَا</foreign>: (Mughnee:) and <foreign lang="ar">ليس غَيْرَ</foreign>; in which the affixed noun [for <foreign lang="ar">المضاف</foreign>, in the K, I read <foreign lang="ar">المضاف اليه</foreign>, as in the Mughnee,] is suppressed, and the noun [of <foreign lang="ar">ليس</foreign>] is also understood: (Mughnee, K:) and <foreign lang="ar">ليس غَيْرُ</foreign>; (Mughnee, K;) in which, accord. to Mbr, and the later authors, <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> is indecl., being likened to <foreign lang="ar">قَبْلُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">بَعْدُ</foreign>, so that it may be either the noun or the enunciative [of <foreign lang="ar">ليس</foreign>] or, accord. to Akh, it is decl., because it is not a noun of time like <foreign lang="ar">قَبْلُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">بَعْدُ</foreign>, nor of place like <foreign lang="ar">فَوْقُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">تَحْتُ</foreign>, but like <foreign lang="ar">كُلٌّ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">بَعْضٌ</foreign>, so that it is the noun [of <foreign lang="ar">ليس</foreign>], and the enunciative is suppressed; (Mughnee;) or it may be either indecl. or decl., (Mughnee, K,) accord. to Ibn-Kharoof: (Mughnee:) and <foreign lang="ar">ليس غَيْرًا</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">ليس غَيْرٌ</foreign>; (Mughnee, K;) in both which cases it is decl., as though the affixed noun were mentioned: (Mughnee:) and <foreign lang="ar">لَا غَيْرُ</foreign>; for the saying, [which we find in the Mughnee,] app. taken from a statement of Seer, that this is incorrect, is not good, since it occurs in the following verse, cited by Ibn-Málik; <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">جَوَابًا بِهِ تَنْجُو ٱعْتَمِدْ فَوَرَبِّنَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَعَنْ عَمَلٍ أَسْلَفْتَ لَا غَيْرُ تُسْأَلُ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Aim thou at</hi> having <hi rend="ital">an answer by which thou mayest be safe; for, by our Lord, respecting an action which thou shalt have done before, not any other thing,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">not anything beside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">else, thou wilt be asked</hi>]. (K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  It does not become determinate by its being prefixed to another noun, because it is very vague: but it is also applied as an epithet to a determinate noun which is near to being indeterminate; as in <foreign lang="ar">صِرَاطَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ٱلَّذِينَ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ غَيْرِ ٱلْمَغْضُوبِ عَلَيْهِمْ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The way of those upon whom Thou hast conferred favour; the other than,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">those who are not, the objects of anger;</hi> (Kur i. 6 and 7;)] because the noun rendered determinate by the art. <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign> denoting a genus is near to being indeterminate, and because when <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> occurs between two contraries its vagueness becomes weakened, (Mughnee, K, *) or altogether departs: (K:) or it is here applied as an epithet to a determinate noun because it resembles a determinate noun in its being prefixed to such a noun: (Msb:) Az says that <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> is here in the gen. case because it is an epithet to <foreign lang="ar">الذين</foreign>; and that it may be an epithet to [what is technically termed in this instance] a determinate noun [as having the article <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign> prefixed to it] because <foreign lang="ar">الذين</foreign> has not [in itself] a direct meaning (<foreign lang="ar">لِأَنَّ الَّذِينَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرُ مَصْمُودٍ صَمْدُهُ</foreign>), [it being merely a conjunct noun, the meaning of which is determined by what follows it,] notwithstanding it has the art. <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign> prefixed to it: Abu-l-'Abbás says that Fr holds <foreign lang="ar">الذين</foreign> to have the office of an indeterminate noun; and <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> to be an epithet of it; not of any other noun; but that <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign>, accord. to some, may be an epithet relating to the nouns implied in <foreign lang="ar">انعمت</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عليهم</foreign>, these not having a direct meaning: Akh says that <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> [with what follows] is a substitute [for <foreign lang="ar">الذين</foreign> with what follows], as though the meaning were <foreign lang="ar">صِرَاطَ غَيْرِ المَغْضُوبِ عَلَيْهِمْ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">the way</hi> 
                  <pb n="2316"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">of those who are not the objects of anger</hi>]. (TA.) The reading <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرَ</foreign> is also related, on the authority of Ibn-Ketheer, in the accus. case, as a denotative of state, [meaning <hi rend="ital">they being not the objects of anger,</hi>] relating to the pronoun governed in the gen. case by the prep. [in <foreign lang="ar">عليهم</foreign>]; or by <foreign lang="ar">أَعْنِى</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I mean</hi>] understood; or as an exceptive, [accord. to a usage to be explained below,] if the favours be interpreted as conferred in common upon the two classes of persons. (Bd.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  As it resembles a determinate noun in its being prefixed to a determinate noun, [as <foreign lang="ar">المغضوب</foreign> in the above-cited passage of the Kur,] some have presumed to prefix to it the article <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign>: but against this it may be urged, that its prefixion to a determinate noun is not to render the expression determinate, but for specification; and <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign> does not imply specification. (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  In the following verse of Hassán, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">أَتَانَا فَلَمْ نَعْدِلْ سِوَاهُ بِغَيْرِهِ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">نَبِىٌّ بَدَا فِى ظُلْمَةِ اللَّيْلِ هَادِيَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> the meaning is, [<hi rend="ital">A prophet came to us, who appeared in the darkness of night, a director in the right way,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">and we did not weigh another than him with another than the other,</hi> i. e., <hi rend="ital">with him.</hi> (Mughnee.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  [<foreign lang="ar">وَغَيْرُ ذٰلِكَ</foreign> is a phrase of frequent occurrence, meaning <hi rend="ital">Et cœtera.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرُ</foreign> is also used in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">لَيْسَ</foreign> [He, or it, <hi rend="ital">is not</hi>]; as in the phrase <foreign lang="ar">كَلَامُ ٱللّٰهِ غَيْرُ مَخْلُوقٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The word of God is not created</hi>], syn. <foreign lang="ar">لَيْسَ بِمَخْلُوقٍ</foreign>. (Az, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  It is also used in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">لَا</foreign> [meaning <hi rend="ital">Not,</hi> as used before a participle]; (S, K;) and then it is in the accus. case, as a denotative of state; (S;) as in the phrase <foreign lang="ar">فَمَنِ ٱضْطُرَّ غَيْرَ بَاغٍ</foreign>, (S, K,) in the Kur [ii. 168, and other places], (S,) i. e., <foreign lang="ar">جَائِعًا لَا بَاغِيًا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">But whosoever is necessitated,</hi> being hungry, <hi rend="ital">not transgressing the due bounds</hi>]. (S, K.)          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  It is also used as an exceptive, (S, Mughnee,) in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Except; save;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">but</hi>]; (Msb, K;) and then it is put in the same case in which the word following <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا</foreign> would be put in the same phrase, (S, Mughnee, Msb, K,) because it is originally a qualificative, and its use as an exceptive is adventitious: (S:) therefore you say <foreign lang="ar">جَآءَ القَوْمُ غَيْرَ زَيْدٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The people came, except Zeyd</hi>]; and <foreign lang="ar">مَا جَآءَنِى أَحَدٌ غَيْرَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">زَيْدٍ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرُ زَيْدٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Not any one came to me, except Zeyd</hi>]: (Msb, K:) or its case depends upon the governing words, so that you say <foreign lang="ar">مَا قَامَ غَيْرُ زَيْدٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">No one stood, except Zeyd</hi>], and <foreign lang="ar">مَا رَأَيْتُ غَيْرَ زَيْدٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I saw not</hi> any, <hi rend="ital">except Zeyd</hi>]: (Msb:) but Fr says that some of the Benoo-Asad and Kudá'ah put <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> in the accus. case, when used in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا</foreign>, whether the phrase before it be complete or incomplete; saying <foreign lang="ar">مَا جَآءَنِى غَيْرَكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Not</hi> any one <hi rend="ital">came to me, except thou</hi>], and <foreign lang="ar">ما جاءنى أَحَدٌ غَيْرَكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Not any one came to me, except thou</hi>]: (S, Msb:) and AA says that when <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> has the place of <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا</foreign>, it is put in the accus. case. (Msb.) In the saying <foreign lang="ar">لَا إِلٰهَ غَيْرُ ٱللّٰهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">There is no deity other than God</hi>], <foreign lang="ar">غير</foreign> is in the nom. case because it is the enunciative of <foreign lang="ar">لا</foreign>; but it may be put in the accus. case, as meaning <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا</foreign>. (Msb.) When, as an exceptive, it is prefixed to an indecl. word [and not preceded by a prep.], it may be itself indecl., with fet-h for its termination; as in the following verse; <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَمْ يَمْنَعِ الشُّرْبَ مِنْهَا غَيْرَ أَنْ نَطَقَتْ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">حَمَامَةٌ فِى غُصُونٍ ذَاتِ أَوْقَالِ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Nought prevented the drinking from it, except that a pigeon cooed, upon branches having</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">اوقال</foreign>, which app. means <hi rend="ital">stumps of cut shoots</hi>]. (Mughnee, K.) [See also an ex. (of <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرَ أَنَّ</foreign>) in a verse cited voce <foreign lang="ar">بَيْدَ</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  [It is often used with a prep.; as in <foreign lang="ar">بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Without reckoning;</hi> (Kur ii. 208, &amp;c.;) and <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوْءٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Without leprosy.</hi> (Kur xx. 23, &amp;c.)]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرٌ</foreign> (JK, K) and (JK)   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32719-1" target="غِيَرٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n32720"/></foreign> (JK, S) signifying The <hi rend="ital">act of altering,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">changing, i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَغْيِيرٌ</foreign>, (JK,) are substs. from <foreign lang="ar">غَيَّرَهُ</foreign>; (S with respect to the latter, and K with respect to the former;) not inf. ns., as having no unaugmented verb. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [Hence,] <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32719-2" target="غِيَرُ" n="2" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>الدَّهْرِ</foreign>, the former of these two words being of the same measure as <foreign lang="ar">عِنَب</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">The accidents,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casualties, of time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortune, which alter,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change, things:</hi> (K:) [or <hi rend="ital">alteration,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">change, of time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of fortune;</hi> for] IAmb says, with respect to the saying <foreign lang="ar">لَا أَرَانِى ٱللّٰهُ بِكَ غِيَرًا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">May God not show me, in thee, alteration of state</hi>], that <foreign lang="ar">غِيَرٌ</foreign> is from <foreign lang="ar">تَغَيُّرُ الحَالِ</foreign>, a subst. like <foreign lang="ar">قِطَعٌ</foreign> [as meaning “ a portion of the night ”]; or that it may be a pl., of which the sing. is   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32719-3" target="غِيْرَةٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [Hence also,] <foreign lang="ar">بَنَاتُ غَيْرٍ</foreign> [or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32719-4" target="غِيَرٍ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, as in Freytag's Arab. Prov. i. 309,] <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Lying:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a lie,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falsehood:</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">كَذِبٌ</foreign>: (TS, K:) or [rather] <hi rend="ital">lies.</hi> (JK, A.) You say <foreign lang="ar">جَآءَ بِبَنَاتِ غَيْرٍ</foreign> [or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32719-5" target="غِيَرٍ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>] <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">He uttered lies.</hi> (A.)    </entryFree>2a:T6c4,<entryFree id="n32722" key="غِيرَةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">غِيرَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A provision of corn,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wheat,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">which a man procures for himself;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">مِيرَةٌ</foreign>; (S, Msb, K,) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32722-1" target="غِيَارٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n32724"/></foreign>: (TA:) [or the latter is probably syn. with <foreign lang="ar">مِيرَةٌ</foreign> used in the sense of an inf. n.:] pl. of the former <foreign lang="ar">غِيَرٌ</foreign>. (Msb.) [See art. <foreign lang="ar">غور</foreign>.]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">غَيْرٌ</foreign>, last sentence but two.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">A bloodwit;</hi> (AA, S, K;) syn. <foreign lang="ar">دِيَةٌ</foreign>: (AA, S: *) and <foreign lang="ar">غِوَرٌ</foreign> is a dial. var. thereof: (TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">غور</foreign>:) pl.   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32722-2" target="غِيَرٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n32720"/></foreign>: (AA, S, K:) or, as some say, this is a sing., (S, TA,) of the masc. gender; TA;) and the pl. is <foreign lang="ar">أَغْيَارٌ</foreign>: (S, TA:) and the <foreign lang="ar">دِيَة</foreign> is said to be termed <foreign lang="ar">غِيَرٌ</foreign> because it is a substitute for retaliation. (TA.)    </entryFree>2b:T471,<entryFree id="n32724" key="غِيَارٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">غِيَارٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> The <hi rend="ital">cognizance,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badge, of the free nonmuslim subjects of a Muslim government; such as the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">زُنَّار</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">waist-belt</hi>] (Mgh, K) <hi rend="ital">to the Magians,</hi> (Mgh,) <hi rend="ital">and the like:</hi> (Mgh, K:) or, as some say, <hi rend="ital">the cognizance,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badge, of the Jews.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">كَلامٌ بِغِيَارِهِ</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">Speech,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language, having its own proper guise; not altered therefrom.</hi> (Msb in <foreign lang="ar">جلف</foreign>.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">غِيرَةٌ</foreign>.    </entryFree>2c:T88a,<entryFree id="n32725" key="غَيُورٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">غَيُورٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32725-1" target="غَيْرَانُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n32723"/></foreign> (S, Msb, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n32725-2" target="غَيَّارٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n32726"/></foreign> (TA) and
